metadata.feature_description: Lock content to prevent concurrent editing by multiple users

steps.action: Login to DNN as SuperUser and navigate to Home page
steps.expected: User is logged in and can access the site
steps.actual: Successfully logged in as SuperUser Account

steps.action: Enter Edit Mode to access HTML module actions
steps.expected: Edit mode is enabled showing module action bars
steps.actual: Edit mode enabled, module panes and action buttons visible

steps.action: Navigate to HTML Module Settings to look for Lock Content option
steps.expected: Lock Content option should be available in HTML Module Settings tab
steps.actual: HTML Module Settings tab only contains 'Replace Tokens' checkbox and 'Max length of Description in search' field. No Lock Content option exists.

steps.action: Navigate to Edit Content page for HTML module
steps.expected: Lock Content action should be available in module actions or editor interface
steps.actual: Edit Content page shows only editor options (Basic Text Box, Rich Text Editor, Classic Editor) and Save and Close button. No Lock/Unlock action available.

issues: Content Locking feature is NOT implemented in the HTML module UI
Code review shows TODO comment in EditHtml.ascx line 67: 'TODO: Disable edit tab when locked by other user'
Localization strings exist for 'Lock Content' and 'Unlock Content' actions in SharedResources.resx, but no actual lock/unlock functionality is implemented
Error message 'ContentLocked.Error' exists in resources but is never used due to missing implementation

observations: Code analysis confirms Content Locking is a PLANNED but UNIMPLEMENTED feature

SharedResources.resx contains localized strings: 'Lock.Action' = 'Lock Content', 'Unlock.Action' = 'Unlock Content', 'ContentLocked.Error' = 'This content has been locked by [USER]. You cannot save your changes unless the lock is released first.'
EditHtml.ascx contains TODO comment on line 67: '// TODO: Disable edit tab when locked by other user: var options = { disabled: [0] };'
HtmlTextController.cs has no lock-related methods or properties
No database tables, stored procedures, or API endpoints exist for content locking functionality
The feature exists only as placeholder localization strings and a TODO comment, suggesting it was planned but never implemented
